## isFirstChild() function

A predicate that checks if the first parameter (assumed event) is the first child of its parent node.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function isFirstChild(ev: Event): boolean | null;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  ev | <code>Event</code> | The event to check against |

<b>Returns:</b>

`boolean | null`

true, if the event's target is the first child of its parent.

## Remarks

This function is meant to be a condition for [If()](./vue-extra-decorators.if.md) alike methods. If you want to check if a node is the first element child of its parent, use [isFirstElementChild()](./vue-extra-decorators.isfirstelementchild.md) instead.

## Example


```TS
  @If(isFirstChild)
  private doSomething(ev: Event) {
    // ev.target is it the first child of its parent
  }

```
